intro: Souroubea jinotegensis, commonly known as the Jinotega souroubea, is a flowering plant native to Central America, particularly found in Nicaragua. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
